"Vasco": "Amazing! This is the first time I've ever seen this sort of scenery."
"When you get far enough away from Aelio, the world really changes, huh? I'm so glad I came here."
"Mmm... If only I could investigate more thoroughly... But, it's so difficult to--"
"AH! Goodness, you gave me a fright!"
"I'm so sorry, I was so lost in thought I didn't even notice you there."
"My name is Vasco. I came here as a member of the Kvaris expedition."
"Kvaris is a fascinating place, isn't it? It's hard to believe it used to be a grassy verdant land."
"That's why I'm here, actually: to look into what exactly happened to this place."
"If you've got some time, do you think you could lend me a hand?"
"I need you to gather Pentrite from Western Kvaris. I'll send your Mag some data so it can point to any that you come across."
"Oh? You don't seem very interested. That's too bad..."
"Thank you very much."
"Wow! Real Pentrite! I've never seen it in person before!"
"Now I suppose I'll give it a full scan, now that I finally can!"
"Oh, don't worry. I'll give it back to you once I'm done scanning it."
"...It's certainly clear that these minerals were formed in a much gentler environment."
"There's no way they would've been able to form in such harsh weather like this."
"In other words, this Pentrite formed when the land still had a temperate climate."
"Well? Don't you think that's interesting? By examining the rocks, we can learn more about the history of this place."
"...Oh, the scan's finished. Thank you very much. I'll give this Pentrite back to you now."
"Research is my area of expertise. I want to gather data for all kinds of things, not just the rock formations."
"Do you think you could continue to help me with this? I'd really appreciate the assistance."
"Oh, hello again. Are you headed out shortly?"
"If you are, there's something I'd like you to do for me."
"I can't fight, so I put my effort into my resarch."
"I'll be waiting here. Best of luck."
"...I see. Sorry for asking at such a busy time."
"Great work. Oooh, so these are the carrots."
"I should be able to study these and get a better understanding of the Kvaris geology."
"What a peculiar shape. I wonder how it's able to grow in such inhospitable climes."
"...It's been in the back of my mind, but Kvaris' environment is rather unnatural in many ways, isn't it?"
"Not just Kvaris, either. There's something about Halpha entirely that just feels... off."
"Like, why does the environment change so drastically from region to region?"
"The creatures also vastly differ between borders."
"Is it even possible for such extreme variations to occur naturally like this?"
"I've carried out a considerable amount of research, but so far I haven't been able to find an explanation."
"However, if I continue my research like so, I believe an answer will be within reach some day."
"Thanks again for today. I hope to be able to count on you again."
"Oh, good timing. Do you have a moment?"
"Yes, I have another request for you."
"It's a bit of a strange request, but I'd appreciate it if you could help nonetheless."
"Please try heading to the designated point."
"I want to try surveying these floating objects."
"Ahhh, I see. That's unfortunate, but I understand."
